lead_paragraph: Few among the thousands who thronged Fifth Avenue yesterday to witness the parade of the Polish organizations of this area in memory of Count Casimir Pulaski, the brilliant soldier of fortune who gave his life in our own struggle for freedom a century and a half ago, can have had an opportunity to read the detailed report on the horrors of the German occupation of Poland recently compiled by the Vatican.
